weapon_properties.Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon.
weapon_properties.Finesse: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
weapon_properties.Heavy: Small creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons.
weapon_properties.Light: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal to use when fighting with two weapons.
weapon_properties.Loading: Because of the time required to load this weapon, you can fire only one piece of ammunition from it when you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it, regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.
weapon_properties.Reach: This weapon adds 5 feet to your reach when you attack with it, as well as when determining your reach for opportunity attacks with it.
weapon_properties.Special: A weapon with the special property has unusual rules governing its use, explained in the weapon's description.
weapon_properties.Thrown: If a weapon has the thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon.
weapon_properties.Two-handed: This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.
weapon_properties.Versatile: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property, indicating the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.

adventuring_gear.name: Acid (vial)
adventuring_gear.description: As an action, you can splash the contents on a creature within 5 feet or throw up to 20 feet. Make a ranged attack. On hit, the target takes 2d6 acid damage.

adventuring_gear.name: Alchemist's fire (flask)
adventuring_gear.description: As an action, throw up to 20 feet. Make a ranged attack. On hit, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

adventuring_gear.name: Ball bearings (bag of 1000)
adventuring_gear.description: As an action, you can spill them to cover a 10-foot-square area. A creature moving through must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

adventuring_gear.name: Caltrops (bag of 20)
adventuring_gear.description: As an action, you can spread them to cover a 5-foot-square area. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 1 piercing damage.

adventuring_gear.name: Candle
adventuring_gear.description: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

adventuring_gear.name: Climber's kit
adventuring_gear.description: Includes pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. Allows you to anchor yourself; when you do, you can't fall more than 25 feet and can't climb more than 25 feet away from the anchor point.

adventuring_gear.name: Crowbar
adventuring_gear.description: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

adventuring_gear.name: Healer's kit
adventuring_gear.description: This kit has ten uses. As an action, you can expend one use to stabilize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

adventuring_gear.name: Holy water (flask)
adventuring_gear.description: As an action, you can splash the contents on a creature within 5 feet or throw up to 20 feet. Make a ranged attack against a fiend or undead. On hit, the target takes 2d6 radiant damage.

adventuring_gear.name: Lamp
adventuring_gear.description: A lamp casts bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

adventuring_gear.name: Lantern, bullseye
adventuring_gear.description: Casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

adventuring_gear.name: Lantern, hooded
adventuring_gear.description: Casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

adventuring_gear.name: Manacles
adventuring_gear.description: Escaping requires a DC 20 Dexterity check. Breaking requires a DC 20 Strength check.

adventuring_gear.name: Oil (flask)
adventuring_gear.description: As an action, splash on a creature within 5 feet or throw up to 20 feet. If the target takes fire damage before the oil dries (1 minute), it takes an additional 5 fire damage.

adventuring_gear.name: Poison, basic (vial)
adventuring_gear.description: You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

adventuring_gear.name: Potion of healing
adventuring_gear.description: You regain 2d4 + 2 hit points when you drink this potion.

adventuring_gear.name: Torch
adventuring_gear.description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch, it deals 1 fire damage.

currency.note: Values are in copper pieces. 10 cp = 1 sp, 5 sp = 1 ep, 2 ep = 1 gp, 10 gp = 1 pp.
